{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3569317,"name":"philso","username":"philso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/e68b1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-26T17:57:44.054Z","cooked":"

Our programmers are having trouble with using an Orange Pi to compress the video stream to be sent to the driver station. The following is a summary from our lead programmer. Any advice would be greatly appreciated. Thanks in advance.

  • Two Arducam OV9782s run through PhotonVision on an OPI 5
  • Two cameras connected through the two USB-A ports
  • After installing high current 12V to 5V converter (9A), Dashboard would connect to the Orange Pi
  • After replacing two Arducams, cameras could connect to dashboard (previous 2 stopped working for unknown reasons)
  • Can get both Arducams to stream off the dashboard
  • When both cameras are plugged into the Orange Pi, robot comms seem to flash in and out as network tables rapidly disconnects and reconnects
  • Unplugging both cameras seems to stabilize robot communications with the Orange Pi
","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-03-26T17:57:44.054Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":26,"reads":95,"readers_count":94,"score":149.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":497013,"topic_slug":"trouble-connecting-with-orange-pi-when-cameras-connected","display_username":"philso","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/raspberry-pi-5-shutting-down-on-robot/497373/6","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Raspberry PI 5 shutting down on robot","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15467,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/trouble-connecting-with-orange-pi-when-cameras-connected/497013/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3569341,"name":"Max Morehead","username":"Max_Morehead","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/max_morehead/{size}/231937_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-26T18:20:36.598Z","cooked":"

Assuming the goal is to have the orange pi stream it’s video to the dashboard (in addition to the whatever vision processing they’re doing), I think we heard from another team that they had reliability issues streaming video from OrangePi running photonvision.

If you have multiple camera streams, you may run into bandwidth issues.

I would generally think it’s better to attach a webcam to the roborio and stream that to the dashboard, if the goal is to provide visual feedback the drivers.

Edit: Nvm, I misremembered a slightly different issue regarding streaming to the photonvision web dashboard. amzoeee elaborates below.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-03-26T18:36:31.306Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":77,"readers_count":76,"score":15.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":497013,"topic_slug":"trouble-connecting-with-orange-pi-when-cameras-connected","display_username":"Max Morehead","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53784,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/trouble-connecting-with-orange-pi-when-cameras-connected/497013/2","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3569355,"name":"zoe","username":"amzoeee","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/amzoeee/{size}/256065_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-26T18:27:22.157Z","cooked":"

By “dashboard,” do you mean the PhotonVision web dashboard, or a DS dashboard like SmartDashboard/Shuffleboard/Elastic/Glass?

We heard from another team about comms issues when streaming camera output to the PhotonVision web dashboard; they solved this by streaming camera output with CameraServer to a DS dashboard.

Thanks for the tips. I will pass it along to the students.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-03-26T18:38:38.564Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":58,"readers_count":57,"score":11.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":497013,"topic_slug":"trouble-connecting-with-orange-pi-when-cameras-connected","display_username":"philso","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15467,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/trouble-connecting-with-orange-pi-when-cameras-connected/497013/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3569731,"name":"Joe Ross","username":"Joe_Ross","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_ross/{size}/37_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-27T01:45:41.786Z","cooked":"

What is your network setup? Ethernet? Wireless? If so 2.4ghz, 6 ghz?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-03-27T01:45:41.786Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":49,"readers_count":48,"score":9.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":497013,"topic_slug":"trouble-connecting-with-orange-pi-when-cameras-connected","display_username":"Joe Ross","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":65,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/trouble-connecting-with-orange-pi-when-cameras-connected/497013/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3569774,"name":"Jim Sokoloff","username":"sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-27T02:52:28.989Z","cooked":"

How are you powering the OPi? I mean “with what cable?” And “how sure are you of the voltage delivered? Each camera adds load to the Pi (for the camera and for the processing).

If you can test with a known-good power supply (even if tethered), you can rule that in/out as a possible issue.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-03-27T02:52:28.989Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":41,"readers_count":40,"score":18.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":497013,"topic_slug":"trouble-connecting-with-orange-pi-when-cameras-connected","display_username":"Jim Sokoloff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66298,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"97 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/trouble-connecting-with-orange-pi-when-cameras-connected/497013/6","custom_user_title":"97 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3570250,"name":"philso","username":"philso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/e68b1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-27T17:35:27.001Z","cooked":"

We are using a 5V, 9A buck regulator to power the Orange Pi. This should give sufficient margin to cover the Orange Pi plus the two cameras.

We were monitoring the output at the terminals of the regulator board using a DVM and did not notice anything anomalous. If necessary, I can bring in my oscilloscope to look for short glitches.

I can verify that it did work when the Orange Pi was plugged into one of the laptops.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-03-27T17:35:27.001Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":30,"readers_count":29,"score":16.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":497013,"topic_slug":"trouble-connecting-with-orange-pi-when-cameras-connected","display_username":"philso","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":66298,"username":"sokoloff","name":"Jim Sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15467,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/trouble-connecting-with-orange-pi-when-cameras-connected/497013/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3570262,"name":"Curt Rozeboom","username":"BlueEpiphone","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/blueepiphone/{size}/197122_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-27T17:45:14.172Z","cooked":"

Just to be sure, you are setting the streaming resolution as low as possible, even though the processed video is higher res, right? Sometimes that option gets hidden below the bottom of the window, or you’ll forget to set it after changing resolutions.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-03-27T17:45:14.172Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":27,"readers_count":26,"score":5.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":497013,"topic_slug":"trouble-connecting-with-orange-pi-when-cameras-connected","display_username":"Curt Rozeboom","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":15467,"username":"philso","name":"philso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/e68b1a/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32089,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5010 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/trouble-connecting-with-orange-pi-when-cameras-connected/497013/8","custom_user_title":"5010 Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3570503,"name":"Jim Sokoloff","username":"sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-27T20:17:45.371Z","cooked":"
philso:

We are using a 5V, 9A buck regulator to power the Orange Pi.

sokoloff:

I mean “with what cable?”

If your cable is too small gauge/too long and the Pi is drawing 2-3A, you might have enough voltage at the output terminal of your regulator but not enough at the Orange Pi.

That it works when plugged into a laptop (perhaps with a different cable?) suggests it could be a power problem.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-03-27T20:17:45.371Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":2,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":20,"readers_count":19,"score":9.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":497013,"topic_slug":"trouble-connecting-with-orange-pi-when-cameras-connected","display_username":"Jim Sokoloff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66298,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"97 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/trouble-connecting-with-orange-pi-when-cameras-connected/497013/9","custom_user_title":"97 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3570604,"name":"philso","username":"philso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/e68b1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-27T22:26:04.156Z","cooked":"

I can ask them to remove the cover for the Orange Pi and probe the pins on the 40 pin connector to compare the voltage with the voltage at the output of the DC-DC converter. We are using one of these cable assemblies, cut to about 5-6 inches long.

https://www.amazon.com/Pigtail-Equipment-Installed-Replacement-Repair/dp/B0D2C74PLY?th=1

Would inserting a powered USB hub between the Orange Pi and the cameras work? The current for the cameras would then be sourced by the USB hub instead of the Orange Pi. Would the Orange Pi be okay with the two camera feeds appearing on one of it’s USB ports instead of each camera appearing on a separate USB port?

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-03-27T22:26:04.156Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":16,"readers_count":15,"score":8.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":497013,"topic_slug":"trouble-connecting-with-orange-pi-when-cameras-connected","display_username":"philso","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.amazon.com/Pigtail-Equipment-Installed-Replacement-Repair/dp/B0D2C74PLY?th=1","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Amazon.com: USB C to 2 Pin Bare Wire Open End Power Cord 3FT, 90 Degree USB Type C Male Plug 2 Pin Pigtail Cable 20AWG 5V, for USB Type C Equipment Installed or Replacement Repair DIY Cable（2Pcs : Electronics","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":66298,"username":"sokoloff","name":"Jim Sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15467,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/trouble-connecting-with-orange-pi-when-cameras-connected/497013/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3570608,"name":"Jim Sokoloff","username":"sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-27T22:34:01.455Z","cooked":"

That wire setup should be fine. It’s 20AWG, copper, and short. I would not bother trying to offload the cameras onto a hub. That’s one more “thing” that has to not fail, and the cameras are only 20-40mA each IIRC. (The OPi is the big draw, though the cameras are not entirely to be ignored, they’re not worth another point of failure.)

Thanks for your feedback.

panic: SysId Units are completely going away!","id":485623,"title":"Don't panic: SysId Units are completely going
